learning_outcomes.description: explain strategic brand marketing concepts, principles, and application
conduct analysis of brand evidence to evaluate brand strategy
justify strategic choices to maintain and grow brand equity in a range of business contexts
develop group work and communication skills to consider alternative perspectives in brand analysis and decision making

assessments.task_description:
The In-Semester Exam will be centrally scheduled on a Saturday during the central In-Semester Exam period.

  • The exam may include multiple choice questions and short-answer questions.
  • The exam will assess course content from Weeks 1 to 6. However, if the exam is scheduled on the earliest Saturday, it will only cover material from Weeks 1 to 5.
  • The examinable content includes the following eight chapters from your course textbook: Chapters 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9 and 10.

More details will be provided once the In-Semester Exam scheduled is released.

AI Statement:

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.due_date:
Week 11 - Week 12

In tutorials in Weeks, 11 and 12.
assessments.task_description:
Students will practice with and apply the brand strategy theory and methods from the course to a brand of their choosing from a pre-approved list.

This is a team project with 4-5 students per group. Students will (i) evaluate the current brand strategy and (ii) develop recommendations for future brand strategy planning.

  • Students will work in teams to complete the assessment.
  • Each team will research brand evidence for their chosen brand.
  • Teams will conduct a focus group using students from their own tutorial as participants. Students will analyse the qualitative data collected from the focus group.
  • Teams will prepare a multimodal PowerPoint presentation summarizing:
  • their research findings
  • insights from the focus group
  • strategic recommendations for the brand
  • All team members will participate in a live oral presentation delivered during their tutorial session, presenting their Brand Strategy Audit to their classmates and tutor.
  • The assessment task should be completed based on the brand strategy theory and principles covered in the course.
  • It is compulsory for students to attend both focus group weeks, in their allocated tutorial, to collect data.
  • Failure to attend both focus group weeks would result in a 5% penalty to your overall group assignment grade, unless supported by a valid medical certificate or written permission from your tutor to attend an alternate class for the focus groups.  

Please Note: The presentation will be recorded for marking purposes per UQ Policy.

Detailed project guidelines will be available on Blackboard. Student teams will present their completed brand strategy audit in class time during their allocated weeks during Tutorial 10 (week 11) and Tutorial 11 (week 12). Tutorial 12 will be used only for groups that missed their presentation in Tutorials 10 and 11 (Weeks 11 and 12).

Peer Assessment. It is important that groups work well together and that everyone does their fair share of the work. This course uses the UQ Group Peer Assessment tool called Buddycheck. All students must complete Buddycheck on Blackboard.  If the peer assessment result indicates that a team member has not been doing their fair share of the work, their marks may be adjusted downward based on peer assessment results. Peer assessment forms are due by the end of the day after your project presentation. To facilitate a shared understanding about how the team will function, team members should agree on a team charter for how the team will operate (a model team charter will be provided as a starter for your team). If your group is having problems, see your tutor as early as possible. If you fear that your team may assess you unfairly, it is important to discuss this with your tutor well before the project is finished. 

For help with how to effectively function in teams by building teams and managing team conflict see the online edX course “Working in Teams: A Practical Guide” www.edx.org/course/working-in-teams-a-practical-guide (link on the Blackboard website).

AI Statement

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Presentations will be performed during scheduled tutorial times, as per the schedule. One member of the group will submit a copy of the group presentation slides on the day of the presentation via the Learn.UQ site. All presentations will be audio and video recorded by the tutor for the purpose of moderation and potential re-marking as per University requirements.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The final assessment will be a formal examination to be held during exam week.

  • The exam may include multiple choice questions, short-answer questions and/or a case study.
  • Any content covered throughout the course may be examined.

Further details will be discussed during the semester, particularly in the Week 13 lecture, and will also be provided in the Assessment folder on Blackboard.

Students are advised to allow sufficient time in their schedules for preparation, with a focus on reviewing all topics covered in the course.

AI Statement:

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
